IDARTICLE: Stqarrija mill-Ministeru għall-Familja, Drittijiet tat-Tfal u Solidarjetà Soċjali: Miżuri diġà maħruġa mid-Dipartiment tas-Saħħa Pubblika
LEGAL_TEXT_OR: Il-Ministeru għall-Familja, Drittijiet tat-Tfal u Solidarjetà Soċjali flimkien mas-Segretarjat Parlamentari għall-Anzjanità Attiva u l-Persuni b’Diżabilità jixtiequ javżaw li b’rabta mal-miżuri diġà maħruġa mid-Dipartiment tas-Saħħa Pubblika qed jittieħdu l-passi preventivi kollha sabiex tiġi assigurata s-sigurtà għar-residenti fid-djar tal-anzjani.
LEGAL TEXT_EN: The Ministry for the Family, Children's Rights and Social Solidarity together with the Parliamentary Secretariat for Active Aging and Persons with Disabilities would like to announce that in connection with the measures already issued by the Department of Public Health they are being taken. all preventive steps to ensure safety for residents in nursing homes.

IDARTICLE: Stqarrija mill-Ministeru għall-Familja, Drittijiet tat-Tfal u Solidarjetà Soċjali: Miżuri diġà maħruġa mid-Dipartiment tas-Saħħa Pubblika
LEGAL_TEXT_OR: Huwa ferm importanti li kull min iħossu ma jiflaħx jew għadu kif vjaġġa fil-pajjiżi indikati mid-Dipartiment tas-Saħħa Pubblika, dan m’għandux iżur il-qraba li jinsabu f’dawn ir-residenzi.
LEGAL TEXT_EN: It is very important that anyone who feels unwell or has just traveled to the countries indicated by the Department of Public Health, should not visit relatives who are in these residences.

IDARTICLE: Stqarrija mill-Ministeru għall-Familja, Drittijiet tat-Tfal u Solidarjetà Soċjali: Miżuri diġà maħruġa mid-Dipartiment tas-Saħħa Pubblika
LEGAL_TEXT_OR: Kull persuna li żżur dar tal-anzjani għandha wkoll taħsel idejha meta tidħol u anki qabel ma toħroġ.
LEGAL TEXT_EN: Every person visiting a nursing home should also wash their hands when entering and even before leaving.

IDARTICLE: Stqarrija mill-Ministeru għall-Familja, Drittijiet tat-Tfal u Solidarjetà Soċjali: Miżuri diġà maħruġa mid-Dipartiment tas-Saħħa Pubblika
LEGAL_TEXT_OR: L-Anzjanità Attiva u Kura fil-Komunità tixtieq tavża li qed tara li f’kull dar residenzjali jkun hemm hand rub disponibbli f’kull entratura.
LEGAL TEXT_EN: Active Aging and Community Care would like to announce that you are seeing a hand rub at every entrance in every residential home.

IDARTICLE: Stqarrija mill-Ministeru għall-Familja, Drittijiet tat-Tfal u Solidarjetà Soċjali: Miżuri diġà maħruġa mid-Dipartiment tas-Saħħa Pubblika
LEGAL_TEXT_OR: Barra minn hekk, il-ħinijiet taż-żjarat se jkunu restritti biss għal waranofinshar u għal filgħaxija u l-viżitaturi għandhom ikunu limitati għal massimu ta’ tnejn ħdejn kull resident.
LEGAL TEXT_EN: In addition, visiting hours will be restricted to late afternoon and evening and visitors should be limited to a maximum of two near each resident.

IDARTICLE: Stqarrija mill-Ministeru għall-Familja, Drittijiet tat-Tfal u Solidarjetà Soċjali: Miżuri diġà maħruġa mid-Dipartiment tas-Saħħa Pubblika
LEGAL_TEXT_OR: Dan japplika wkoll għar-residenza ta’ San Vinċenz De Paul.
LEGAL TEXT_EN: This also applies to the residence of St. Vincent De Paul.

IDARTICLE: Stqarrija mill-Ministeru għall-Familja, Drittijiet tat-Tfal u Solidarjetà Soċjali: Miżuri diġà maħruġa mid-Dipartiment tas-Saħħa Pubblika
LEGAL_TEXT_OR: Barra minn hekk fir-residenza ta’ San Vinċenz De Paul inbdiet sistema ta’ monitoraġġ għal dawk kollha li jidħlu f’din ir-residenza.
LEGAL TEXT_EN: In addition, a monitoring system has been set up at the San Vincenzo De Paul residence for all those who enter this residence.

IDARTICLE: Stqarrija mill-Ministeru għall-Familja, Drittijiet tat-Tfal u Solidarjetà Soċjali: Miżuri diġà maħruġa mid-Dipartiment tas-Saħħa Pubblika
LEGAL_TEXT_OR: Qed jiġi wkoll avżat li l-appuntamenti għas-servizzi tal-outpatients f’din ir-residenza se jiġu skedati għal dati oħra.​
LEGAL TEXT_EN: It is also advised that appointments for outpatient services at this residence will be scheduled for other dates.

LEGAL_TEXT_OR: IN EXERCISE of the powers conferred by article 26 of thePublic Health Act, hereinafter referred to as "the Act", the Ministerresponsible for public health, in consultation with the Superintendentof Public Health, has made the following regulations:
1.The  title  of  these  regulations  is  the  Enforcement  ofDirections relating to Quarantine Regulations, 2020.

2.In accordance with regulations 27(c) and 29(1) of the Act,the Superintendent of Public Health, hereinafter referred to as "theSuperintendent", is hereby prescribing measures to guard against and,or to control the COVID-19 infectious disease.

3.Any period of quarantine imposed by the Superintendentshall be strictly adhered to in accordance with such directions as maybe given by the said Superintendent, under the provisions of article29(1) of the Act.

4.Any person who fails to abide by the provisions of theseregulations shall be guilty of an offence and shall, on conviction, beliable to the payment of a penalty of one thousand euro for each andevery occasion that the quarantine period is breached
IN EXERCISE of the powers conferred by article 27(c) of thePublic Health Act, the Superintendent of Public Health has made thefollowing order:-
1.The  title  of  this  order  is  the  Closure  of  Schools  Order,2020.

2.In this order, unless the context otherwise requires:"school" means an institution the resources of which, bothof persons and of things, are ordained towards the promotion ofthe  education  and  training  of  other  persons  through  thedissemination of knowledge and shall include:_x000d_

(g)  further and higher educational institution; and

2.In this order, unless the context otherwise requires:"school" means an institution the resources of which, bothof persons and of things, are ordained towards the promotion ofthe  education  and  training  of  other  persons  through  thedissemination of knowledge and shall include:_x000d_

(h)  ELT schools; and

IDARTICLE: Stqarrija mill-MFCS u mis-Segretarjat Parlamentari għall-Anzjanità Attiva u l-Persuni b’Diżabilità: Temporanjament, se jitwaqqfu ż-żjarat kollha fid-djar tal-anzjani
LEGAL_TEXT_OR: Bħala prevenzjoni, fid-dawl tal-aħħar żviluppi fit-tifrix ta’ Covid-19, il-Ministeru għall-Familja, Drittijiet tat-Tfal u Solidarjetà Soċjali flimkien mas-Segretarjat Parlamentari għall-Anzjanità Attiva u l-Persuni b’Diżabilità qed javżaw li b’effett immedjat, temporanjament, se jitwaqqfu ż-żjarat kollha fid-djar tal-anzjani.
LEGAL TEXT_EN:
Bħala prevenzjoni, fid-dawl tal-aħħar żviluppi fit-tifrix ta’ Covid-19, il-Ministeru għall-Familja, Drittijiet tat-Tfal u Solidarjetà Soċjali flimkien mas-Segretarjat Parlamentari għall-Anzjanità Attiva u l-Persuni b’Diżabilità qed javżaw li b’effett immedjat, temporanjament, se jitwaqqfu ż-żjarat kollha fid-djar tal-anzjani. Dawn jinkludu dawk tal-gvern, dawk tal-knisja, dawk privati u r-residenza ta’ San Vinċenz De Paul._x000d_
_x000d_
Se jkunu jistgħu jidħlu biss u f’każi eċċezzjonali dawk il-persuni li jirrakkomandaw in-nursing officer, jew it-tabib jew il-kap tad-dar residenzjali stess. Din l-għażla se tiġi ddeterminata abbażi tal-kundizzjoni tar-resident, liema kundizzjoni gravi tkun tiġġustifika t-tali eċċezzjoni._x000d_
_x000d_
Barra minn hekk qabel ma jidħol, kwalunkwe viżitatur se jsirlu l-istess monitoraġġ li qed isir bħalissa._x000d_
_x000d_
Din il-proċedura tapplika wkoll għad-djar residenzjali għall-persuni b’diżabilità._x000d_
_x000d_
Kulħadd huwa mitlub jifhem li f’dan iż-żmien hemm bżonn li jittieħdu l-miżuri kollha meħtieġa sabiex jiġu ssalvagwardjati l-anzjani u l-persuni vulnerabbli. Din id-deċiżjoni, bħad-deċiżjonijiet l-oħra li l-Gvern qed jieħu f’dan il-perjodu, qed tittieħed għall-ġid tagħna u l-għeżież tagħna

IDARTICLE: Stqarrija mill-MFCS u mis-Segretarjat Parlamentari għall-Anzjanità Attiva u l-Persuni b’Diżabilità: Temporanjament, se jitwaqqfu ż-żjarat kollha fid-djar tal-anzjani
LEGAL_TEXT_OR: Dawn jinkludu dawk tal-gvern, dawk tal-knisja, dawk privati u r-residenza ta’ San Vinċenz De Paul.
LEGAL TEXT_EN: These include the government, the church, the private sector and the residence of St. Vincent De Paul.

IDARTICLE: Stqarrija mill-MFCS u mis-Segretarjat Parlamentari għall-Anzjanità Attiva u l-Persuni b’Diżabilità: Temporanjament, se jitwaqqfu ż-żjarat kollha fid-djar tal-anzjani
LEGAL_TEXT_OR: Se jkunu jistgħu jidħlu biss u f’każi eċċezzjonali dawk il-persuni li jirrakkomandaw in-nursing officer, jew it-tabib jew il-kap tad-dar residenzjali stess.
LEGAL TEXT_EN: Only those who recommend the nursing officer, or the doctor or the head of the residential home themselves will be able to enter and in exceptional cases.

IDARTICLE: Stqarrija mill-MFCS u mis-Segretarjat Parlamentari għall-Anzjanità Attiva u l-Persuni b’Diżabilità: Temporanjament, se jitwaqqfu ż-żjarat kollha fid-djar tal-anzjani
LEGAL_TEXT_OR: Din l-għażla se tiġi ddeterminata abbażi tal-kundizzjoni tar-resident, liema kundizzjoni gravi tkun tiġġustifika t-tali eċċezzjoni.
LEGAL TEXT_EN: This option will be determined on the basis of the resident's condition, which serious condition would justify such an exception.

IDARTICLE: Stqarrija mill-MFCS u mis-Segretarjat Parlamentari għall-Anzjanità Attiva u l-Persuni b’Diżabilità: Temporanjament, se jitwaqqfu ż-żjarat kollha fid-djar tal-anzjani
LEGAL_TEXT_OR: Barra minn hekk qabel ma jidħol, kwalunkwe viżitatur se jsirlu l-istess monitoraġġ li qed isir bħalissa.
LEGAL TEXT_EN: This procedure also applies to residential homes for the disabled.

IDARTICLE: Stqarrija mill-MFCS u mis-Segretarjat Parlamentari għall-Anzjanità Attiva u l-Persuni b’Diżabilità: Temporanjament, se jitwaqqfu ż-żjarat kollha fid-djar tal-anzjani
LEGAL_TEXT_OR: Kulħadd huwa mitlub jifhem li f’dan iż-żmien hemm bżonn li jittieħdu l-miżuri kollha meħtieġa sabiex jiġu ssalvagwardjati l-anzjani u l-persuni vulnerabbli.
LEGAL TEXT_EN: Everyone is asked to understand that at this time all necessary measures need to be taken to safeguard the elderly and vulnerable.

IDARTICLE: Stqarrija mill-MFCS u mis-Segretarjat Parlamentari għall-Anzjanità Attiva u l-Persuni b’Diżabilità: Temporanjament, se jitwaqqfu ż-żjarat kollha fid-djar tal-anzjani
LEGAL_TEXT_OR: Din id-deċiżjoni, bħad-deċiżjonijiet l-oħra li l-Gvern qed jieħu f’dan il-perjodu, qed tittieħed għall-ġid tagħna u l-għeżież tagħna
LEGAL TEXT_EN: This decision, like the other decisions that the Government is taking in this period, is being taken for our good and our loved ones.

LEGAL_TEXT_OR: IN EXERCISE of the powers conferred by article 27(c) of thePublic Health Act, the Superintendent of Public Health has made thefollowing order:-
1.The  title  of  this  order  is  the  Epidemics  and  InfectiousDisease (Suspension of Legal and Judicial times) Order, 2020.
2.In this order, unless the context otherwise requires:

"court" means any court and includes the superior courtsand the inferior courts including appellate courts irrespective oftheir competence or jurisdiction, and also includes any tribunalestablished by law, and any boards, commissions, committees orother  entities  before  which  any  proceedings  are  heard  orprocedures  undertaken  which  are  subject  to  legal  oradministrative time limits for filing any claims, defences or otheracts;
"registry" means the registry of any court;
"Superintendent" has the same meaning as assigned to it inthe Public Health Act.

3.(1)  When  the  Superintendent  orders  the  closure  of  allcourts or of any court for the purpose of guarding against and, orcontrolling dangerous epidemics or infectious disease, such order shallsuspend the running of any legal and judicial times and of any othertime limits including peremptory periods applicable to proceedings orother procedures before the said courts.
The suspension shall last untilseven (7) days following the lifting of the repeal of any such order bythe  Superintendent

Without  prejudice  to  the  generality  of  theforegoing, such suspension shall mean that if the last day of any legalor judicial time or other time limit expires during the time when anorder provided for in this regulation is in force, the running of thetimes shall be suspended until seven (7) days after the day when theSuperintendent repeals the order for the closure of any court by noticein the Gazette.VERŻJONI ELETTRONIKA

(2)  Any order issued in accordance with sub-article (1) shallnot  prejudice  the  power  of  any  court  to  order  the  opening  of  itsregistry,  the  hearing  of  any  case  and  anything  consequential  andincidental thereto in urgent cases or in cases where it deems that thepublic interest in having the case heard should prevail, subject to anyspecific  arrangements  for  the  guarding  against  and,  or  controllingdangerous epidemics or infectious disease as the court may determine.
IN EXERCISE of the powers conferred by article 27© of thePublic Health Act, the Superintendent of Public Health has made thefollowing order:-
1.The title of this order is the Closure of the Courts of JusticeOrder, 2020.
2.In this order, unless the context otherwise requires:

"court" means any courts and includes the superior courtsand the inferior courts including appellate courts irrespective oftheir competence or jurisdiction, and also includes any tribunalestablished by law, and any boards, commissions, committees orother  entities  before  which  any  proceedings  are  heard  orprocedures  undertaken  which  are  subject  to  legal  oradministrative time limits for filing any claims, defences or otheracts; "registry" means the registry of any court;
"Superintendent" shall have the same meaning as assignedto in the Public Health Act.

3.The Superintendent hereby orders the closure of the Courtsof Justice and the registry with effect from the 16th March, 2020,which  order  shall  remain  in  force  until  it  is  revoked  by  theSuperintendent.

IN  EXERCISE  of  the  powers  conferred  by  article  26  of  thePublic Health Act, the Minister responsible for public health, afterconsultation with the Superintendent of Public Health, has made thefollowing regulations-:

1.The  title  of  these  regulations  is  the  Enforcement  ofDirections relating to Quarantine (Amendment) Regulations, 2020 and these  regulations  shall  be  read  and  construed  as  one  with  the Enforcement  of  Directions  relating  to  Quarantine  Regulations,hereinafter referred to as "the principal regulations".
2.Regulation  4  of  the  principal  regulations  shall  besubstituted by the following:

4.  Any  person  who  fails  to  abide  by  theprovisions  of  these  regulations  shall  be  guilty  of  anoffence and shall, on conviction, be liable to the paymentof a penalty of three thousand euro (€3,000) for each andevery occasion that the quarantine period is breached.".VERŻJONI ELETTRONIKA
IN EXERCISE of the powers conferred by article 27(c) of thePublic Health Act, the Superintendent of Public Health has made thefollowing order:-
1.The title of this order is the Suspension of Legal Timesrelating to Promise of Sale Agreements, Notarial and other relatedmatters (Epidemics and Infectious Disease) Order, 2020.
2.In this order, unless the context otherwise requires:

"court" means any court and includes the superior courtsand the inferior courts including appellate courts irrespective oftheir competence or jurisdiction, and also includes any tribunalestablished by law, and any boards, commissions, committees orother  entities  before  which  any  proceedings  are  heard  orprocedures  undertaken  which  are  subject  to  legal  oradministrative time limits for filing any claims, defences or otheracts;
"Superintendent" shall have the same meaning as assignedto it in the Public Health Act.

3.When the Superintendent orders the closure of all courts orany courts, for the purpose of guarding against and, or controllingdangerous  epidemics  or  infectious  disease,  the  suspension  of  therunning of all the legal terms imposed on a notary public by law toregister any deed, will, act or private writing or any period withinwhich the notary public, in terms of any applicable law, has to paytaxes collected by him in the exercise of his profession or any termrelated to fiscal benefits, incentives or exemptions or any period withinwhich a notary public is to submit any information or documentationto any authority or regulator pursuant to relevant notarial activity andany expiration of any term in any promise of sale agreement dulyregistered in terms of law with the Commissioner of Revenue withinthe period established by law shall be suspended whilst the order forclosure  is  in  force  without  the  need  of  any  signatures  or  formalrenewals by the parties.
The suspension shall last until twenty (20) days following the repeal of any such order by the Superintendent.
4.The Epidemics and Infectious Disease (Suspension of legaltimes  relating  to  promise  of  sale  agreements,  notarial  and  relatedmatters) Order is hereby repealed.
IN EXERCISE of the powers conferred by article 27(c) of thePublic Health Act, the Superintendent of Public Health has made thefollowing order:-

1.The  title  of  this  order  is  the  Period  of  Quarantine(Amendment) Order, 2020 and this order shall be read and construedas one with the Period of Quarantine Order hereinafter referred to as"the principal order".

2.In  sub-article  (1)  of  the  principal  order,  the  words  "hisarrival in Malta." shall be substituted by the words "his arrival inMalta:" and immediately thereafter there shall be added the followingproviso:

Provided that the Superintendent of Public Healthmay, in her absolute discretion, suspend the provisions of thisorder or provide for other conditions, by notice in the Gazette,where, in the opinion of the said Superintendent, the quarantineof certain persons providing an essential service be subject todifferent conditions.".VERŻJONI ELETTRONIKA

IN  EXERCISE  of  the  powers  conferred  by  article  26  of  thePublic Health Act, the Minister responsible for public health, afterconsultation with the Superintendent of Public Health, has made thefollowing regulations:-
1.(1)  The title of these regulations is the Enforcement ofthe Order relating to Closure of Places Open to the Public Regulations,2020.
(2)  These regulations shall come into force on the 18th March2020.
2.In these regulations, unless the context otherwise requires:
"the Act" means the Public Health Act;
"Superintendent"  means  the  Superintendent  of  PublicHealth.
3.In accordance with regulations 27(c) and 29(1) of the Act,the Superintendent of Public Health,  is hereby prescribing measures toguard against and, or to control the COVID-19 infectious disease.
.Any order issued by the Superintendent for the closure ofplaces open to the public in accordance with the Closure of PlacesOpen to the Public Order shall be strictly adhered to.

5.Any person who fails to abide by the provisions of theseregulations shall be guilty of an offence and shall, on conviction, beliable to the payment of a penalty of three thousand euro (€3,000)foreach and every occasion that the order for closure of places open to thepublic is breached.VERŻJONI ELETTRONIKA

IN EXERCISE of the powers conferred  by  article  16  of  theTrading Licences Act, the Minister responsible for Local Government,after consultation with the Minister responsible for Commerce, hasmade the following regulations:-
1.The title of these regulations is the Issue of Permits byLocal Councils (Repeal) Regulations, 2020.
2.The Issue of Permits by Local Councils Regulations, 2020are hereby repealed.

IN  EXERCISE  of  the  powers  conferred  by  article  26  of  thePublic Health Act, the Minister responsible for public health, afterconsultation with the Superintendent of Public Health, has made thefollowing regulations:
1.(1)  The title of these regulations is the Enforcement ofthe  order  relating  to  Closure  of  Non-Essential  Retail  Outlets  andOutlets Providing Non-Essential ServicesRegulations, 2020.
(2)  These regulations shall come into force on the 23rd March,2020.
2.In these regulation, unless the context otherwise requires:
"the Act" means the Public Health Act;
"Superintendent"  means  the  Superintendent  of  PublicHealth.
.In  accordance  with  article  27(c)  of  the  Act,  theSuperintendent is hereby prescribing measures to guard against and, orto control the COVID-19 infectious disease.
4.The Closure of Non-Essential Retail Outlets and OutletsProviding  Non-Essential  Services  Order,  2020  issued  by  theSuperintendent, shall be strictly adhered to

5.Any person who fails to abide by the provisions of theseregulations shall be guilty of an offence and shall, on conviction, beliable to the payment of a penalty of three thousand euro (€3, 000) foreach and every occasion in which that person breaches the Closure ofNon-Essential  Retail  Outlets  and  Outlets  Providing  Non-EssentialServices Order, 2020.
IN EXERCISE of the powers conferred by article 27(c) of thePublic Health Act, the Superintendent of Public Health has made thefollowing order:-
1.(1)  The  title  of  this  order  is  the  Self-Isolation  ofDiagnosed Persons Order, 2020
(2)  This order shall come into force on the 23rd March, 2020.

2.(1)  The Superintendent of Public Health hereby ordersthat  any  person  who  is  diagnosed  as  suffering  from  COVID-19infectious disease shall, immediately upon receiving an oral or writtenorder, as the case may be, from the Superintendent of Public Health,submit himself to self-isolation and shall remain in self-isolation untilthe Superintendent of Public Health revokes the oral or written order.
(2)  This order shall apply also to persons who live in the sameresidence as the person referred to in sub-article (1)

N  EXERCISE  of  the  powers  conferred  by  article  26  of  thePublic Health Act, the Minister responsible for public health, afterconsultation with the Superintendent of Public Health, has made thefollowing regulations:-
1.The  title  of  these  regulations  is  the  Enforcement  of  theorder relating to the Number of Persons in Public Spaces Regulations,2020.
2.In these regulations, unless the context otherwise requires:
"the Act" means the Public Health Act;
"Superintendent"  means  the  Superintendent  of  PublicHealth.
3.In  accordance  with  article  27(c)  of  the  Act,  theSuperintendent, is hereby prescribing measures to guard against and,or to control the COVID-19 infectious disease.
4.The  Number  of  Persons  in Public  Spaces  Order,  2020issued by the Superintendent, shall be strictly adhered to.

5.Any person who fails to abide by the provisions of theseregulations shall be guilty of an offence and shall, on conviction, beliable to the payment of a penalty of one hundred euro (€100) for eachand  every  occasion  in  which  that  person  breaches  the  Number  of Persons in Public Spaces Order, 2020.
IN EXERCISE of the powers conferred by articles 14 and 27(c)of  the Public Health  Act,  the Superintendent of  Public Health hasmade the following order:-
1.The title of this order is the Declaration of a Public HealthEmergency Order, 2020.
.(1)  In accordance with article 14 of the Public HealthAct, the Superintendent of Public Health hereby declares that witheffect from the 7th March, 2020 a public health emergency exists.
(2)  The  public  health  emergency  follows  the  COVID-19 pandemic and applies to Malta.
IN EXERCISE of the powers conferred by article 27(c) of thePublic  Health  Act,  the  Superintendent  of  Health  has  made  thefollowing order:-
1.The title of this order is the Closure of the Local TribunalsOrder, 2020.
2.In this order, unless the context otherwise requires:
"local tribunals" means the tribunals established by means of the Local  Tribunals  (Establishment  of  Tribunals  and  Designation  ofRegistry, Registrar and Other Officers) Regulations;
"registry" means the registry of any local tribunal;
"summons" shall have the same meaning as assigned to it by theLocal Tribunals (Delivery of Summons) Regulations;
"Superintendent" shall have the same meaning as assigned to inthe Public Health Act.

3.The Superintendent hereby orders the closure of the localtribunals and the registry with effect from the 30th March, 2020, whichorder shall remain in force until it is revoked by the Superintendent.

4.Any  legal,  judicial  or  administrative  time-limit  for  thefiling of any acts before the local tribunals shall be suspended for aperiod of twenty (20) days from the lifting of the repeal of this orderby the Superintendent.
5.Any service of summons shall be suspended until a periodof ten (10) days from the lifting of the repeal of this order by theSuperintendent.
IN EXERCISE of the powers conferred by article 27(c) of thePublic  Health  Act,  the  Superintendent  of  Health  has  made  thefollowing order:-
1.The  title  of  this  order  is  Suspension  of  Legal  Times(Revenue Acts) Order, 2020.
2.In this order, unless the context otherwise requires -
"closure order" means an order issued in accordance with sub-article (1) of article 4;
"period of closure" means the period commencing on the day aclosure order comes into effect and ending on the day on which anorder repealing that closure order is published;
"revenue  Act"  means  the  Income  Tax  Act,  the  Duty  onDocuments and Transfers Act the Income Tax Management Act, andthe Value Added Tax Act;
"revenue  department"  means  any  department  or  office  fallingunder the responsibilities of the Commissioner for Revenue for theadministration of any revenue Act;
"Superintendent" shall have the same meaning as assigned to it inthe Public Health Act;
"tax" means any tax or duty payable in terms of any revenue Act.
3.(1)  Any legal time referred to in sub-article (2) shall besuspended with effect from the date on which this order comes intoforce.
(2)  This article applies to all legal times, including prescriptionperiods and peremptory periods imposed under any revenue Act orunder any other law for -

(a)  the making by the Commissioner for Revenue of anyassessment,  demand  for  payment,  request  for  information,decision or order, and the issue and service of any notice thereof;VERŻJONI ELETTRONIKA
(b)  the payment by the Commissioner for Revenue of anyrefund of tax;

(c)  the  institution,  execution  or  continuation  of  anyjudicial  action  for  the  collection  of  tax,  additional  tax,administrative  penalty  or  interest,  or  for  the  prosecution  orrequest for the prosecution of any criminal offence.

(3)  The  suspension  of  legal  times  under  this  article  shallremain in force until such date as may be prescribed by means ofanother order made by the Superintendent under the Public Health Act.
(4)  Without  prejudice  to  the  provisions  of  this  article,  thesuspension of legal times under this article shall mean that:

(a)  any  legal  time  to  which  this  article  applies  thatcommenced running before the suspension has come into forcebut has not expired before that date shall be suspended and shallcontinue running again for the period remaining as at that date asfrom the date that the suspension does not remain in force;

(b)  any legal time to which this article applies that, wereit  not  for  this  order,  would  commence  running  while  thesuspension is in force shall commence running as from the datethat the suspension does not remain in force.

4.(1)  When the Superintendent orders the closure of anyrevenue  department  for  the  purpose  of  guarding  against  and,  orcontrolling dangerous epidemics or infectious disease, any legal timereferred in sub-article (2) that would expire, were it not for this order,during the period of closure or during the period of twenty-eight (28)days following the period of closure shall be suspended.
(2)  This article applies to times imposed under any revenueAct for -
(a)  the furnishing, delivery, filing or submission to theCommissioner for Revenue of any return, form, claim, objection,appeal, notice or information;
(b)  the payment or remittance to the Commissioner forRevenue  of  any  tax  due  by  or  collected  or  withheld  by  anyperson:

Provided that this article shall not apply to and shallnot suspend any legal time imposed under any revenue Act forthe submission of any return, form, claim or notice or the makingof  any  payment  that  in  terms  of  that  Act  is  required  to  be submitted or made by electronic means.

(3)  The suspension of a legal time as provided in this articleshall mean that, notwithstanding the provisions of the relevant revenueAct or of any other law, that time shall be deemed to expire on thetwenty-eighth (28th) day following the period of closure.
IN EXERCISE of the powers conferred by article 3 of the Legaland  Other  Time  Periods  (Suspension  and  Interruption)  Act,  theMinister of justice has made the following regulations:-
1.(1)  The  title  of  these  regulations  is  the  GeneralProvisions applying to the Suspension of Legal and Judicial TimesRegulations, 2020.
(2) These regulations shall be deemed to have come into forceon the 2nd April, 2020.
2.In these regulations, unless the context otherwise requires:
"the  Act"  means  the  Legal  and  Other  Time  Periods(Suspension and Interruption) Act;
"court" shall have the same meaning assigned to it in theAct as may be amended from time to time;
"registered promise of sale agreement" means a promise ofsale  agreement,  registered  with  the  Commissioner  of  InlandRevenue in terms of law within the period established by law;
"registry" means the registry of any court;
"Superintendent" shall have the same meaning as assignedto it in the Public Health Act.
3.(1)  Following  the  publication  of  the  Closure  of  theCourts of Justice Order, the Minister, by virtue of these regulationshereby suspends the running of any time period:
(a)  under any substantive or procedural law, includingany period of prescription and any peremptory period;
(b)  decreed  or  otherwise  ordered  by  any  court,government department, government agency or public authority; and

(c)  established  in  any  agreement  (whether  a  privatewriting  or  a  public  deed),  including  any  time  period  for  theperformance of any obligation set out in such agreement, if andto the extent that the closure has a direct effect on the ability ofany party to exercise its rights or to perform its obligations interms of the same agreement.

(2)  Any time periods suspended in accordance with paragraphs(a) and (b) of sub-regulation (1) shall remain so suspended until seven(7) days following the lifting of the said order of the Superintendentand shall thereafter continue to run.

(3)  Any time period suspended pursuant to paragraph (c) ofsub-regulation (1) shall remain suspended until the twentieth (20th)day following the lifting of the said order of the Superintendent andshall thereafter continue to run.
(4)  For the avoidance of doubt, but without prejudice to thegenerality of sub-regulation (1), the suspension in sub-regulation (1)shall apply to each of the following:
(a)  the  running  of  all  the  legal  periods  imposed  on  anotary public by law to register any deed, will, act or privatewriting; or
(b)  the  running  of  any  period  within  which  a  notarypublic, in terms of any applicable law, must pay taxes collectedby him in the exercise of his profession; or
(c)  the  running  of  any  time  period  related  to  fiscalbenefits, incentives or exemptions;
(d)  the running of any time period within which a notarypublic is to submit any information or documentation to anyauthority or regulator pursuant to relevant notarial activity; and

(e)  the running of time with respect to the performance ofany  obligation  contained  in  any  deed  or  private  writing,including  a  registered  promise  of  sale  agreement;  and  therunning of time with respect to the expiration of any registeredpromise of sale agreement
(5)  Any time period suspended pursuant to sub-regulation (4)shall  remain  suspended  for  the  same  period  prescribed  by  sub-regulation (3).

4.The provisions of these regulations are without prejudice toany order made by the Superintendent in terms of the Public Health Act and nothing in these regulations shall be interpreted as a limitationor an amendment to any such order. Where these regulations and anyorder issued by the Superintendent provide for different time limits thelonger time limits provided for shall apply.

IN  EXERCISE  of  the  powers  conferred  by  article  26  of  thePublic Health Act, the Minister responsible for public health, afterconsultation with the Superintendent of Public Health, has made thefollowing regulations:

1.The  title  of  these  regulations  is  the  Enforcement  of  theorder relating to Closure of Non-Essential Retail Outlets and OutletsProviding  Non-Essential  Services(Amendment)  Regulations,  2020and  these  regulations  shall  be  read  and  construed  as  one  with  theEnforcement of the order relating to Closure of Non-Essential RetailOutlets  and  Outlets  Providing  Non-Essential  Services  Regulations,hereinafter referred to as the "principal regulations".

2.In regulation 4 of the principal regulations, immediatelyafter the words "Non-Essential Services Order, there shall be added thewords "and the Closure of Non-Essential Retail Outlets and OutletsProviding Non-Essential Services (Amendment) Order, 2020.".

3.In regulation 5 of the principal regulations, mmediately after the words "Non-Essential Services Order" there shall be addedthe words "and the Closure of Non-Essential Retail Outlets and OutletsProviding Non-Essential Services (Amendment) Order, 2020.
IN EXERCISE of the powers conferred by article 27(c) of the Public Health Act, the Superintendent of Public Health has made thefollowing order:-
1.(1)  The title of this order is the Number of Persons inPublic Spaces (Increase in Number of Persons) Order, 2020.
(2)  This order shall come into force on the 4th May, 2020.

2.In  furtherance  to  the  third  proviso  of  article  3  of  the Number  of  Persons  in  Public  Spaces  Order,  the  Superintendent  of Public Health is hereby increasing the number of persons in publicspaces to four (4) persons.
IN EXERCISE of the powers conferred by article 27(c) of thePublic Health Act, the Superintendent of Public Health has made thefollowing order:-

1.(1)  The title of this order is the Epidemics and InfectiousDisease (Suspension of Legal and Judicial times) (Amendment No. 2)Order, 2020, and this order shall be read and construed as one with theEpidemics and Infectious Disease (Suspension of Legal and JudicialTimes) Order, herein after referred to as the "principal order".
(2)  This order shall come into force on the 4th May 2020.
2.In sub-article (2) of article 3 of the principal order, thewords "the opening of its registry," shall be deleted.

3.Any time limits which were suspended prior to the cominginto force of the Epidemics and Infectious Disease (Suspension of Legaland  Judicial  times)  (Amendment  No.  2)  Order,  2020  shall  remain suspended.
IN EXERCISE of the powers conferred by article 27(c) of thePublic Health Act, the Superintendent of Public Health has made thefollowing order:-

1.(1)  The title of this order is the Closure of Non-EssentialRetail  Outlets  and  Outlets  Providing  Non-essential  Services(Amendment  No.  2)  Order,  2020  and  this  order  shall  be  read  andconstrued as one with the Closure of Non-Essential Retail Outlets andOutlets Providing Non-essential Services Order, hereinafter referred toas "the principal order".
(2)  This order shall come into force on the 22nd May, 2020.
2.Article  3  of  the  principal  order  shall  be  amended  as follows:

(a)  sub-article  (1)  thereof  shall  be  substituted  by  thefollowing new sub-article:_x000d_
_x000d_
"(1) The  Superintendent  of  PublicHealth  hereby  orders  the  closure  of  thefollowing  outlets  providing  non-essentialservices: spas and tattooists."; and

(b)  sub-article (2) shall be substituted by the followingnew sub-article:_x000d_
_x000d_
"(2) The  Superintendent  of  Public  Healthhereby orders that vaping shops shall open solelyand exclusively for sale of products permissible inaccordance  with  the  Tobacco  (Smoking  Control)Act and for no other service, and clients are not toremain  inside  the  vaping  shops  after  availingthemselves of such products.".
IN EXERCISE of the powers conferred by article 27(c) of thePublic Health Act, the Superintendent of Public Health has made thefollowing order:-

1.(1)  The title of this order is the Suspension of OrganisedEvents (Amendment) Order, 2020 and this order shall be read andconstrued  as  one  with  the  Suspension  of  Organised  Events  Order,2020, hereinafter referred to as the "principal order".
(2)  This order shall come into force on the 22 May, 2020.

2. In article 2 of the principal order, the words "Open to the Public Order." shall be substituted by the words "Open to the PublicOrder:" and immediately thereafter there shall be added the followingnew provisos:

"Provided  that  sports  activities  organised  in  accordancewith the list issued by the Superintendent of Public Health forindividual and group training of not more than six (6) persons inopen spaces are exempt from this order and that they are subjectto mitigation measures issued by the Superintendent of PublicHealth:

Provided further that the Superintendent of Public Healthmay, at her discretion, grant an exemption which is subject tomeasures  which  the  Superintendent  may  impose,  if  she  issatisfied that the organized event will be held in public or openspaces  and  that  the  event  organised  is  such  as  to  enable  thepublic  to  maintain  social  distance  and  other  preventivemeasures.".
IN EXERCISE of the powers conferred by article 27(c) of thePublic Health Act, the Superintendent of Public Health has made thefollowing order:-

1.(1)  The title of this order is the Number of Persons inPublic Spaces (Increase in Number of Persons) (Amendment) Order,2020  andthis  order  shall  be  read  and  construed  as  one  with  theNumber of Persons in Public Spaces (Increase in Number of Persons)Order, hereinafter referred to as "the principal order".
(2)  This order shall come into force on the 22nd May, 2020.
2.In article 2 of the principal order, the words "to four (4)persons." shall be substituted by the words "to six (6) persons.".
IN EXERCISE of the powers conferred by article 27(c) of thePublic Health Act, the Superintendent of Public Health has made thefollowing order:-

1.(1)  The title of this order is the Suspension of OrganisedEvents (Amendment No. 2) Order, 2020, and this order shall be readand construed as one with the Suspension of Organised Events Order,herein after referred to as the "principal order".
(2)  This order shall come into force on the 5th June, 2020.
2.Regulation 2 of the principal order shall be substituted bythe following new regulation:
"2.The Superintendent of Public Health hereby ordersthat the organisation of contact sports shall be suspended:
Provided  that  the  Superintendent  of  Public  Healthmay, at her discretion, grant an exemption which is subject tomeasures which the Superintendent may impose.".
IN EXERCISE of the powers conferred by article 27(c) of thePublic Health Act, the Superintendent of Public Health has made thefollowing order:-
.(1)  The title of this order is the Closure of the Courts ofJustice (Repeal) Order, 2020.
(2)  This order shall come into force on 5th June, 2020

2.The Closure of the Courts of Justice Order 2020 is herebyrepealed with effect from the 5th June 2020, without prejudice to thevalidity of anything done or omitted to be done on the basis thereofand subject to the provisions of this order.

3.The suspension of the time limits as in force prior to thecoming into force of this Order for the filing of any acts before a courtfollowing  the  conclusion  of  any  proceedings  before  any  Tribunal,board, commission, committee or other entity which does not operatefrom  a  building  of the Courts  of Justice shall  remain  in  force fortwenty (20) days from the coming into force of this order.

4.The  suspension  of  time  limits  as  in  force  prior  to  thecoming into force of this order for the filing of any acts before a courtor other tribunal, board, commission, committee or other entity whichoperates from the building of the Courts of Justice shall remain inforce for a period of seven (7) days from the coming into force of thisorder.
IN EXERCISE of the powers conferred by article 27(c) of thePublic Health Act, the Superintendent of Public Health has made thefollowing order:-

1.(1)  The title of this order is the Number of Persons inPublic Spaces (Amendment) Order, 2020 and this order shall be readand construed as one with the Number of Persons in Public SpacesOrder, herein after referred to as the "principal order".
(2)  This order shall come into force on the 5th June, 2020.

2.Regulation 3 of the principal order shall be substituted bythe following new regulation 3:_x000d_
_x000d_

IN EXERCISE of the powers conferred by article 27(c) of thePublic  Health  Act,  the  Superintendent  of  Health  has  made  thefollowing order:-
1.The  title  of  this  order  is  Suspension  of  Legal  Times(Revenue Acts) (Repeal) Order, 2020.

2.The  Suspension  of  Legal  Times  (Revenue  Acts)  Order,hereinafter referred to as "the principal order", is hereby repealed witheffect from the 15th June 2020, without prejudice to the validity ofanything done or omitted to be done on the basis thereof and subject tothe provisions of this order.
3.In consequence of the repeal of the principal order:

(a)  any legal time that was suspended by virtue of theprincipal order and that had commenced running before the dateon which the suspension came into force but had not expiredbefore  that  date  shall  continue  running  again,  for  the  periodremaining as at that date, as from the 15th June 2020;

(b)  any legal time that was suspended by virtue of theprincipal order and that, were it not for that order, would havecommenced running while the suspension was in force, shallcommence running as from the 15th June 2020.
